questions.question: Demonstrate the proper hand signal for a left turn.
questions.result: LEFT ARM STRAIGHT OUT POINTING LEFT

questions.question: Bicycle riders and automobile drivers follow the same rules and have the same rights.
questions.result: TRUE - Example: Cars must stop at a stop sign, and bicycles must stop at a stop sign.

questions.question: A bicycle rider should ride facing traffic.
Bicycles, unlike motor vehicles, don't need regular maintenance.
questions.result: FALSE - Bicycles require regular maintenance to assure proper operation.

questions.question: It's okay if a child lets a friend ride on the handlebars, as long as they stay within a residential area.
A bicycle must stop at stop signs.
Some cities and counties prohibit riding bicycles on sidewalks.
A bicycle rider can wear headsets over both ears.
It is against the law to ride a bicycle under the influence of alcohol and/or drugs.
A child riding as a passenger on a bicycle does not need to wear a bicycle helmet if they are riding with an adult.
questions.result: FALSE - A person under 18 years of age cannot ride as a passenger without a properly fitted and fastened bicycle helmet.
